subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown

On Friday 27 May 2005 11:51, Cedric Beust wrote:
> Yes.  Except that partial failures of setUp are not handled properly
> (and they will flag all the tests as "FAILURES", which is incorrect: 
> the tests were simply not run and the error is in setUp(), not in the
> test methods).

What is a partial failure? Either it fails or it succeeds, why is it 
important to distingiush any further?

The set up belongs to the test. I think it is reasonable to say the test 
fails if its setup fails.

Cheers,

Robert
